result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) .126. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) .126 was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian P. Hall was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:38 p.m. Defendant Brian P. Hall in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Special Prosecutor Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed letters provided by Defendant - State in receipt of letters. Michlig/Rielly/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Prison - 4 1/2 years
Initial Confinement - 3 years
Extended Supervision - 18 months
CC/DNA Sample/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
No intoxicants; no taverns unless employed by tavern and only for purposes of employment
Jail credit - 3 days
AODA Assessment
Driver's Safety Plan
Driver's license revoked -  3 years
IID - 12 months
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant is remanded immediately.
Appeal rights given. WEDS given. NADVI given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 3:55 p.m.
Defense Sentencing Exhibit 1

9:35 a.m. Defendant Brian P. Hall in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bail continued. Adj. 9:42 a.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-23-2016 09:30 am

3:30 p.m. Defendant Brian P. Hall in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rielly states not ready for resolution - requests jury trial date - Michlig/Rielly state 1 day is sufficient. Bail continued. Adj. 3:35 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

3:02 p.m. Defendant Brian P. Hall in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Brian Colombino, RPD, sworn, direct. Witness identifies defendant. Cross by Rielly. State's Exh. 1 (Certified driver record) marked, offered, received. State's Exh. 2 (Lab findings) marked, offered, received. Court statement--finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. Rielly enters not guilty plea based on Information to be filed includes same count and possibly PAC violation. Court orders Information filed no later than 9/14/15. Defendant pleads not guilty. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

1:36 p.m. Defendant Brian P. Hall in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly appearing telephonically with leave of court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adj. 1:37

3:03 p.m. Defendant Brian P. Hall in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding attorney.  Defendant states still waiting for proceeds of life insurance money for retainer for attorney; expects money by end of this week. Court orders defendant to be evaluated by PD.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

03:25 pm - Defendant Brian P. Hall in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states did not contact PD.  Contacted attorney Michael Rielly.  Has cashed in life insurance policy, but has not rec'd the money yet and as such does not have Rielly officially on retainer.  Contacted insurance company and was told would receive money next week.  Court adjourns.  Defendant states was not fingerprinted while in custody.  Court directs defendant to go directly to jail to be fingerprinted.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
no intoxicants in any amount in any location, no taverns except for purposes of employment

01:51 pm - Defendant Brian P. Hall in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
